intro: Psychotria guillotii, commonly known as the Guianan psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Venezuela. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and small, tubular flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments within lowland and montane rainforests. Psychotria guillotii is often found growing in the understory of dense tropical vegetation.
